translations: v.是……的特征；使……具有特点；刻划……的性格（或特征）；

sentences.sentence: Their Olaf Street Study, a square of brick-strewn waste ground, is one of the few works here to embrace the mundanity that characterises most of our experience of the landscape most of the time.
sentences.translation: 他们的作品《奥拉夫街研究》是为数不多能够体现世俗的作品，这一世俗大多时候都能够反应我们对自然景观的体验。

sentences.sentence: It characterises the strength of the force between electrically charged particles.
sentences.translation: 它表示带电粒子间的力量强度。

sentences.sentence: A selfless compassion characterises the Jedi order, so your reward is not money or fame.
sentences.translation: 绝地武士的法则，是无私的同情，因此您的奖励并非金钱，也不是声名。
